com.redhat.rhn.manager.user

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.manager.BaseManager
      • com.redhat.rhn.manager.user.UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends BaseManager
    UserManager - the singleton class used to provide Business Operations on Users where those operations interact with other top tier Business Objects. Operations that require the User make changes to

      • getDefaultSystemGroupIds

        public static java.util.Set getDefaultSystemGroupIds(User usr)
        Get the set of default system groups for this user
        Parameters:
        usr - User for which to get the default system groups.
        Returns:
        groupSet Set of default system groups IDs for the user.

      • setDefaultSystemGroupIds

        public static void setDefaultSystemGroupIds(User usr,
                            java.util.Set groups)
        Set the defaultSystemGroups for the specified User. This method first deletes all current groups and then adds all of the specified groups. The assumption is that we never add a lot of default system groups at one time, so it is cheaper to just delete and re-add than to compute the difference and commit just the changes.
        Parameters:
        usr - User for which to set the default groups.
        groups - Set of groups to associate with the user.

      • loginUser

        public static User loginUser(java.lang.String username,
             java.lang.String password)
                      throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Login the user with the given username and password.
        Parameters:
        username - User's login name
        password - User's unencrypted password.
        Returns:
        Returns the user if login is successful, or null othewise.
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - if login fails. The message is a string resource key.

      • loginReadOnlyUser

        public static User loginReadOnlyUser(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
                              throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        This method should be ONLY called when we need to authenticate read-only user e.g. for purpose of the API calls Login the user with the given username and password.
        Parameters:
        username - User's login name
        password - User's unencrypted password.
        Returns:
        Returns the user if login is successful, or null othewise.
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - if login fails. The message is a string resource key.

      • usersInOrg

      • removeChannelPerm

        public static void removeChannelPerm(User user,
                     java.lang.Long cid,
                     java.lang.String role)
        Removes channel permissions from a user or nothing if they already have no channel permissions.
        Parameters:
        user - The user for which the perm is changing
        cid - The channel identifier
        role - The role the user is losing for this channel.

      • addChannelPerm

        public static void addChannelPerm(User user,
                  java.lang.Long cid,
                  java.lang.String role)
        Adds channel permissions from a user. Does nothing if the channel cannot be viewed by this user's org
        Parameters:
        user - The user for which the perm is changing
        cid - The channel identifier
        role - The role the user is gaining for this channel.

      • satelliteHasUsers

        public static boolean satelliteHasUsers()
        Method to determine whether a satellite has any users. Returns true if satellite has one or more users, false otherwise. Also returns false if this method is called on a hosted installation.
        Returns:
        true if satellite has one or more users, false otherwise.

      • lookupUserServerPreferenceValue

        public static boolean lookupUserServerPreferenceValue(User user,
                                      Server server,
                                      java.lang.String preferenceName)
        Looks up the value of a user's server preference.
        Parameters:
        user - user to lookup the preference
        server - server that the preference corresponds to
        preferenceName - the name of the preference
        Returns:
        true if no value is present, false if the value is present and equal to 0 otherwise
        See Also:
        UserServerPreferenceId

      • setUserServerPreferenceValue

                                Server server,
                                java.lang.String preferenceName,
                                boolean value)
        Sets a UserServerPreference to true or false
        Parameters:
        user - User whose preference will be set
        server - Server we are setting the perference on
        preferenceName - the name of the preference
        value - true if the preference should be true, false otherwise
        See Also:
        UserServerPreferenceId
